summary: In this context, 1,2,4-trimethylbenzene and n-hexanal are both categorized as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) contributing to the global VOC score, which assesses air pollution levels in dwellings. They are included in different specific VOC categories: 1,2,4-trimethylbenzene as an aromatic hydrocarbon and n-hexanal as an aldehyde. However, there is no direct interaction or specific relationship discussed between these two compounds beyond their classification as VOCs.
